critical.issue: Checkpointing example ignores error return: `store := checkpoint.NewSQLiteStore("./checkpoints.db")` but actual signature is `NewSQLiteStore(path string) (*SQLiteStore, error)`
Documents non-existent `Node[S]` wrapper type with `ID` and `Func` fields. Implementation uses `NodeFunc[S]` directly in `map[string]NodeFunc[S]` - no wrapper struct exists
critical.fix: Remove Node[S] type definition entirely. Show actual: `type Graph[S any] struct { nodes map[string]NodeFunc[S] ... }`

critical.issue: Documents non-existent `Edge` type with `From`, `To`, `Condition` fields. Implementation uses separate maps: `edges map[string][]string` and `conditionalEdges map[string]RouterFunc[S]`
critical.fix: Remove Edge type definition. Update to show actual: unconditional edges in `map[string][]string`, conditional in `map[string]RouterFunc[S]`. No unified Edge struct exists.

critical.issue: CompiledGraph struct shows wrong field types: `nodes map[string]Node[S]` and `edges map[string][]Edge` - both types don't exist
critical.fix: Update to actual fields: `nodes map[string]NodeFunc[S]`, `edges map[string][]string`, `conditionalEdges map[string]RouterFunc[S]`, `successors map[string][]string`, `predecessors map[string][]string`, `isConditional map[string]bool`

critical.issue: Compilation algorithm shows iterating over non-existent Edge struct with edge.From/edge.To fields. Actual implementation iterates `for from, targets := range g.edges`
critical.fix: Rewrite algorithm section to match actual implementation using map iteration, not Edge struct iteration

critical.issue: Badge URLs reference 'github.com/rmurphy/flowgraph' but this is not a public repository URL. These badges will not work until the repository is published.
critical.fix: Either remove badge placeholders or update to correct repository URL when published. Change 'rmurphy' to actual GitHub username.

critical.issue: LICENSE link references LICENSE file that does not exist in repository.
critical.fix: Add LICENSE file (MIT as mentioned in README) or remove the link until LICENSE is added.

critical.issue: Example ignores error: `store, _ := checkpoint.NewSQLiteStore("./checkpoints.db")` - should handle error or explain why ignored
critical.fix: Change to proper error handling or add comment explaining why ignored in example context

important.issue: Outdated coverage numbers: Claims 'flowgraph: 89.1%, checkpoint: 91.3%, llm: 74.7%' but actual is 'flowgraph: 95.4%, checkpoint: 91.7%, llm: 93.2%, observability: 90.6%'
important.fix: Update line to: **Coverage**: flowgraph: 95.4%, checkpoint: 91.7%, llm: 93.2%, observability: 90.6%

important.issue: RouterFunc signature shown without Context parameter: `RouterFunc[S any] func(state S) string` but actual is `func(ctx Context, state S) string`
important.fix: Change to: `RouterFunc[S any] func(ctx Context, state S) string`

important.issue: nextNode() implementation shows calling router as `(*edge.Condition)(ctx, state)` but Edge type doesn't exist. Actual uses conditionalEdges map
important.fix: Update to show actual implementation accessing conditionalEdges map

important.issue: Documents future Metrics interface but observability package already exists with MetricsRecorder implementation
important.fix: Update to reference actual MetricsRecorder implementation, remove '(Future)' marker

important.issue: Documents future OpenTelemetry tracing but SpanManager already implemented in observability package
important.fix: Update to reference actual SpanManager implementation, remove '(Future)' marker

important.issue: Coverage claim '90%+ test coverage' is accurate but could be more precise - actual is 93.7% overall
important.fix: Optional: Update to '93%+ test coverage' for more precision

important.issue: Marked as '[Unreleased]' but Phase 6 completion indicates this should be tagged as a release version.
important.fix: Either tag a v0.1.0 release or add explanation for why still unreleased despite completion

important.issue: Line count 128 lines is within target for project-level CLAUDE.md (target: 150-180) but no duplication check performed against parent
important.fix: Verify no duplication of core principles, error handling philosophy, or testing patterns from global CLAUDE.md

minor.issue: States 'Requires Go 1.22 or later' but go.mod shows 'go 1.24.0' - minor version mismatch
minor.fix: Optional: Update to 'Requires Go 1.24 or later' to match go.mod exactly

minor.issue: References 'Python (ai-devtools/ensemble)' as source but provides no context about where this is or whether it's relevant to users.
minor.fix: Either add link/context to Python implementation or remove reference as it's not relevant to Go users

minor.issue: No file:line references in documentation - AI documentation standards recommend adding them for implementation details
minor.fix: Optional: Add file:line references like 'graph.go:27' when referencing implementation details for better AI navigation

phantom_types_found: Node[S] struct with ID and Func fields
Edge struct with From, To, Condition fields

validation_notes: CRITICAL: docs/ARCHITECTURE.md documents two non-existent types (Node[S] and Edge) throughout
CRITICAL: README.md checkpointing example will not compile due to ignored error
All working examples compile and run successfully - examples are accurate
README Quick Start example tested and works correctly (outputs 2 as expected)
Test coverage is HIGHER than documented (95.4% vs 89.1% claimed in CLAUDE.md)
Import paths are consistent but repository URL needs updating before publication
No LICENSE file exists but MIT is claimed in README - must add before v0.1.0 release
Most critical issues are phantom type definitions in ARCHITECTURE.md that describe non-existent abstractions
Actual implementation uses simpler map-based approach instead of Node/Edge wrapper structs
RouterFunc signature changed from initial design (added Context param) but ARCHITECTURE.md not updated
Observability features marked as '(Future)' are actually implemented - documentation outdated
CLAUDE.md follows hierarchical inheritance principles (128 lines, no obvious duplication from global)
No file:line references used anywhere - opportunity to improve AI navigability
